intro: Brachistus ceratocalycius, commonly known as the horned calyx brachistus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the tips of its stems. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in fine hairs, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Brachistus ceratocalycius is often found growing in rocky soils and is a popular species among succulent enthusiasts.
